Description: A twisted, knotted thread of flax fibre, now in two pieces, on which are strung four amulets of green glazed composition: a hawk, a debased Taweret amulet, a human figure (?) and a crouching man.
Curator's comments: Possibly once a single string with 1907,0511.505. Bibliography: Register and Diary of D.G. Hogarth's excavations at Asyut, 1907 and Report to the Trustees of the British Museum, all in MSS.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (255)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr David George Hogarth
